p: The annual mean temperature was another important variable that affected the distribution of P. tenuifolia ( Fig 3b). When the annual mean temperature fell below -2.5°C, the presence probability of finding P. tenuifolia was less than 5%. When this temperature was in the range of 8.4°C to 15.4°C, the presence probability was higher than 50%. In other words, regions with such a range of annual temperature may be better candidates for planting P. tenuifolia.
